comment: Courtesy of AT - Rich, spicy, and sweet. Caramel, honey, and orange notes. Oak barrels come through in the nose. Not quite on par with the Quinta Ruban, but still another winner from GM.

Rich, creamy, moderately long finish. The big flavors that hope out are barley, buttercream, honey and subdued oak. Evidently, Glenmorangie grows some pretty stellar grain, and it’s the star of the show here.
Unique flavor, chocolate covered oranges. Greatness in a bottle
Sweet, very fruity a nice light whisky. Not as rich as the 14 Quinta Reuben but very nice sipping scotch. A good dessert whisky

Check out my video review here 


https://youtu.be/M29vpd5OXGI



.
Nothing like be comforted by a serving of Banana's Foster dripping in caramel accentuated by baking spices.

Not a review but a comment on the latest evidence that supplies are catching up with demand as inventory matures, creating room for lower prices. Per Whisky Advocate: “The Cadboll Estate is priced about 15% lower than the Private Edition releases, and it’s likely significantly more aged... I suspect the distillery has an ample stock of well-aged single malt and a solid plan for keeping pricing competitive even as tariffs and Brexit are causing a lot of uncertainty in that area.” I’m planning to sit out most of the new releases this year and try to make more of a dent in my existing collection, in the expectation that the market is only going to get better for buyers next year and beyond.
